segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender uniquely identifies the Quality Data Message by means of its type and number.

DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the quality data message date.
Example of the use of this DTM-segment is : date/time frame of reported data that apply to the whole quality data message.
The Date/time/period segment within other segment groups should be used whenever the date/time/period requires to be logically related to another specified data item; e.g. date of measurement must be specified within the measurement segment group.
IMD, A segment for describing the product involved.
MEA, A segment to allow physical measurements and dimensions to be stated, where this is required for identification of the product.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to give further clarification, when required, to the whole message. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to handle this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A segment group for referencing documents and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message, e.g. purchase order, shipment/consignment number.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties relevant to the whole Quality Data Message, with associated information.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of parties, in coded or clear form, and their function relevant for the whole Quality Data Message. Identification of the Sender and Receiver party is mandatory for the Quality Data Message. They are to be given in the NAD segment.
LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific locations related to the party specified in the NAD- segment, e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A segment group giving references and where necessary, date information only relevant to the specified party.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the reference. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: SG10-SG12-SG20-SG30 A group of segments providing the relevant quality data for the specified product.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item by its number and additionally, identifying the product involved by a product identification number. Other product identification numbers are specified in the following PIA segment, e.g. Customer part number, etc.
PIA, A segment providing additional product identification to that specified in the LIN segment, e.g. Buyer part number.
IMD, A segment for describing the product involved. This segment should be used for products that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.
MEA, A segment to allow physical measurements and dimensions to be stated, where this is required for identification of the product.

PSD, A segment to define the physical sample parameters, associated with a test, resulting in discrete measurements. If used in this position, the values apply to all following values of product properties.
SPS, A segment to define the sampling parameters associated with summary statistics reported. If used in this position, the values apply to all following values of product properties.

DTM, A segment specifying date/time/period details to the line item only. Any specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.
QTY, A segment to enable quantity information to be specified.

FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form, to give further clarification, when required, for the line item. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to handle this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A segment group for referencing documents relating to the line item and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information, relevant to the line item only.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of parties, in coded or clear form, and their function relevant for the line item.
LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific locations related to the party specified in the NAD- segment, e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group giving references and where necessary, date information only relevant to the specified party.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time of the reference. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to provide details of the test methods, employed including any circumstances, test devices, references and dates.

segment.documentation: TEM, A segment to describe the nature of the test performed.
MEA, A segment to provide the necessary values of the various circumstances related to the tests, e.g. temperature reading when test performed.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. test date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A segment group of referencing documents relating to the test method and where necessary, their dates, e.g. device number.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to be used to define a class of properties, the individual properties within that class and the related data (e.g. discrete values, statistical information, test methods). When this segment group is used, the data is directly related to the product specified.

segment.documentation:
CCI, To specify the general class and/or the individual properties on which the Quality Data is being reported. Note: within the CCI-segment Property class, coded (7059) or Measurement dimension, coded (6313) or Characteristic identification (7037) must be present.
If Property class, coded (7059) AND Measurement dimension, coded (6313) are present, then Characteristic identification (7037) is not allowed.
If only Property class, coded is used within the CCI-segment, then the individual properties must be specified within the related STA/MEA-segments.
The data element Characteristic (7036) should only be used to enhance the meaning of the code value (e.g. if no specific code available and code value ZZ (mutually defined) is used then Description can be used to further describe the Product Characteristics.
NB: The Class identification element in this segment is only used to specify the product characteristic class, e.g. Chemistry or Physical Dimensions.

PSD, A segment to define the physical sample parameters associated with a test resulting in discrete measurements. If used in this position, the values only apply to data within the same analysis group.
SPS, A segment to define the sampling parameters associated with summary statistics reported. If used in this position, the values only apply to data within the same analysis group.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. date/time, test performed.
FTX, A segment with free text information to give further clarification within Segment group 12: the Analysis Group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A segment group of referencing documents relating to the Analysis Section and where necessary, their dates, e.g. Purchase order, shipment note.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to allow measurement values or specification values to be specified along with their associated references and dates. The data element Measurement Application Qualifier (6311) indicates the type of the values.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify discrete values, other measurement results or specification values. These values may be specified as a range and may be qualified by the significance and/or the attribute codes.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. test date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A Segment group of referencing documents relating to the specifications and values and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments to provide the necessary information for summary statistics with any related references and dates.

segment.documentation: STA, A segment to specify the values required for statistics including codes to define the type of statistics and the measure unit employed.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. time frame of statistical period.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A Segment group of referencing documents relating to the statistics and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments to provide details of the test methods, employed including any circumstances, test devices, references and dates.

segment.documentation: TEM, A segment to describe the nature of the test performed.
MEA, A segment to provide the necessary values of the various circumstances related to the tests, e.g. temperature reading when test performed.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A Segment group of referencing documents relating to the test method and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments to enable batch related information to be specified.

segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing specific serial or batch numbers, relating to the specified product. These may be single numbers or ranges of numbers.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier., e.g. batch process date.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A Segment group of referencing documents relating to the batch and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments to be used to define a class of properties, the individual properties within that class and the related data (e.g. discrete values, statistical information, test methods). When this segment group is used, the data is directly related to the product specified.

segment.documentation:
CCI, To specify the general class and/or the individual properties on which the Quality Data is being reported. Note: within the CCI-segment Property class, coded (7059) or Measurement dimension, coded (6313) or Characteristic identification (7037) must be present.
If Property class, coded (7059) AND Measurement dimension, coded (6313) are present, then Characteristic identification (7037) is not allowed.
If only Property class, coded is used within the CCI-segment, then the individual properties must be specified within the related STA/MEA-segments.
The data element Characteristic (7036) should only be used to enhance the meaning of the code value (e.g. if no specific code available and code value ZZ (mutually defined) is used then Description can be used to further describe the Product Characteristics.
NB: The Class identification element in this segment is only used to specify the product characteristic class, e.g. Chemistry or Physical Dimensions.

PSD, A segment to define the physical sample parameters associated with a test resulting in discrete measurements. If used in this position, the values only apply to data within the same analysis group.
SPS, A segment to define the sampling parameters associated with summary statistics reported. If used in this position, the values only apply to data within the same analysis group.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. date/time, test performed.
FTX, A segment with free text information to give further clarification within Segment group 22: the Analysis Group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A segment group of referencing documents relating to the Analysis Section and where necessary, their dates, e.g. Purchase order, shipment note.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments to allow measurement values or specification values to be specified along with their associated references and dates. The data element Measurement Application Qualifier (6311) indicates the type of the values.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify discrete values, other measurement results or specification values. These values may be specified as a range and may be qualified by the significance and/or the attribute codes.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. test date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A Segment group of referencing documents relating to the specifications and values and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segment.documentation: STA, A segment to specify the values required for statistics including codes to define the type of statistics and the measure unit employed.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. time frame of statistical period.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A Segment group of referencing documents relating to the statistics and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments to provide details of the test methods, employed including any circumstances, test devices, references and dates.

segment.documentation: TEM, A segment to describe the nature of the test performed.
MEA, A segment to provide the necessary values of the various circumstances related to the tests, e.g. temperature reading when test performed.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A Segment group of referencing documents relating to the test method and where necessary, their dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments to allow process related quality data to be specified.

segment.documentation: PRC, A segment to specify the process/sub-process type and description to which the data is related.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments identifying Names, Addresses and Locations relevant to the process.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of parties, in coded or clear form, and their function relevant for the process.
LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific locations related to the party specified in the NAD- segment, e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments to be used to define a class of properties, the individual properties within that class and the related data (e.g. discrete values, statistical information, test methods). When this segment group is used, the data is directly related to the product specified.

segment.documentation:
CCI, To specify the general class and/or the individual properties on which the Quality Data is being reported. Note: within the CCI-segment Property class, coded (7059) or Measurement dimension, coded (6313) or Characteristic identification (7037) must be present.
If Property class, coded (7059) AND Measurement dimension, coded (6313) are present, then Characteristic identification (7037) is not allowed.
If only Property class, coded is used within the CCI-segment, then the individual properties must be specified within the related STA/MEA-segments.
The data element Characteristic (7036) should only be used to enhance the meaning of the code value (e.g. if no specific code available and code value ZZ (mutually defined) is used then Description can be used to further describe the Product Characteristics.
NB: The Class identification element in this segment is only used to specify the product characteristic class, e.g. Chemistry or Physical Dimensions.

PSD, A segment to define the physical sample parameters associated with a test resulting in discrete measurements. If used in this position, the values only apply to data within the same analysis group.
SPS, A segment to define the sampling parameters associated with summary statistics reported. If used in this position, the values only apply to data within the same analysis group.
DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. date/time, test performed.
FTX, A segment with free text information to give further clarification within Segment group 32: the Analysis Group.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and where appropriate, a line number within that document.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time of an activity identified by the date/time qualifier, e.g. test date/time.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.

DTM, A segment specifying the date/time of the referenced document. The specified date should be in 'yymmdd' format, unless all parties agree that there is a functional requirement for an alternative format.
